thread.title: 3 killed in plane crash in southwestern Minnesota are identified - @KSTP
thread.title_full: 3 killed in plane crash in southwestern Minnesota are identified - @KSTP

author: Tom Brew
title: 3 killed in plane crash in southwestern Minnesota are identified - @KSTP
text:
Created: 07/28/2015 5:22 AM KSTP.com By: Jennie Lissarrague 
A pilot and two passengers who were killed when a small plane went down in a cornfield in southwestern Minnesota have been identified. 
The Pipestone County Sheriff’s Office says the pilot was 59-year-old Steven Christensen of Pipestone. The passengers were 18-year-old Marcos Favela of Torreon, Mexico, and a 13-year-old girl from Guadalajara, Mexico. 
The crash was reported just after 8 p.m. Monday near Holland, Minnesota, which is about 10 miles northeast of Pipestone. 
First responders found a small fixed-wing airplane in a corn field in Grange Township. All three occupants were pronounced dead at the scene. 
The crash is under investigation by the Pipestone County Sheriff’s Office and the Federal Aviation Administration. An aerial view of the plane crash Photo: KSFY-TV
